Case reference: 2014004546.CaseDesc: On November 10, 2004, Roy Lewis was last seen hitchhiking in Sackville, New Brunswick.

Case reference: 2014001521.CaseDesc: On November 3, 1972, a helicopter carrying a pilot and three passengers went missing in Lake Winnipeg. The helicopter left Thompson, Manitoba at 3:20 p.m. and was heading for Winnipeg after stopping at a number of communities. The helicopter landed at Warren's Landing at approximately 5:20 p.m., and left for Winnipeg. The pilot reported that the weather was poor and he estimated his arrival in Winnipeg at 8:00 p.m. At 5:50 p.m. there was radio contact with the pilot where he stated that he was over Poplar River. This was the last radio contact with this helicopter. The Canadian Air Search and Rescue, private aircraft and police aircraft searched until November 17, 1972 when the search was suspended until the spring of 1973. Nathan Kryger and Ian Fraser are presumed dead as a result of the helicopter crash. Foul play is not suspected.

Case reference: 2018013207.CaseDesc: On the morning of March 12, 2018, Ariel Kouakou left his home, on foot, to go to a friend’s house. At around 11:15 am, a witness walking a dog saw Ariel on the bicycle path in Park of la Merci located between Gouin Boulevard and the Rivière des Prairies.

Case reference: 2006012799.CaseDesc: John Crofts last resided in a retirement home on Yearly Road in Huntsville. He was last seen in the Huntsville area on December 25, 1997.

Case reference: 2014001462.CaseDesc: Gareth Austin was last seen on August 17, 1995, and was last known to be in Medicine Hat, Alberta with Dominic Park.

Scar: Left Hand, Scar top of left hand

Case reference: 2014002340.CaseDesc:
Margaret Schochenmaier was last seen on November 30, 1985, sometime after 3:00pm.  On that day Margaret was in the process of moving from her son's residence; but she never finished the move.
Margaret has previously gone missing in the past, usually for a few days to one month.

Scar: Forehead, Small scar on the left side

Case reference: 2014002843.CaseDesc: A party of 6 men departed Churchill, Manitoba, on a fishing trip traveling in three canoes. On June 20, 1967, two of the three canoes became stranded on mud flats at a point where the Hayes and Nelson Rivers empty into the Hudson Bay. The men made camp for the night and then the following day Kurt Hild, Ronald Davidson and James Cochrane all attempted to retrieve the stranded canoes. On return to the camp the men were confronted with high winds and freezing rain which forced them out of sight. None of the remains of the men have been recovered. Foul play is not suspected in the matter.

Case reference: 2020049381.CaseDesc: On November 6, 2020 Sean Hart was last seen leaving Seven Oaks Receiving Home in Victoria, British Columbia.  Sean has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014005578.CaseDesc: On August 27, 1980, Alexander Calder was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta. Mr. Calder was transient in nature, and frequented social service agencies in the downtown area of Edmonton. He was also known to frequent Edmonton’s river valley, and is described as having a cognitive impairment.

Case reference: 2014004896.CaseDesc: On September 22, 2002, Aiqiu Chen was seen for the last time as she was leaving her brother’s home in Toronto, Ontario. Aiqiu left with all of her belongings.

Case reference: 2014004730.CaseDesc: Geoffry MacGibbon was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. In 1978, Geoffrey and his family moved to Toronto, Ontario from Quebec. He is schizophrenic and has been in several mental institutions in Canada and the United States of America.

Scar: Front Of Neck, Tracheostomy scar on throat

Case reference: 2014002748.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1981, Jerry Torarak was last seen at 11:15 p.m. He had been travelling back to Hopedale, NL from Railroads, NL via boat with family. Approximately 15 miles off shore from Hopedale, Jerry fell over board into the water and sank out of sight.

Case reference: 2019068219.CaseDesc: On November 17, 2019, Marshal Iwaasa was last seen by his family in Lethbridge, Alberta. During this time, Marshal had told his family that he was returning to Calgary, Alberta. On November 23, his burnt vehicle was recovered at the end of Phelix Creek Forest Service Road, in a remote area near the Birkenhead Lake Provincial Park in British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014006313.CaseDesc: On Wednesday, November 13, 2013, Carey Cadeau left his residence in Chelmsford. He did not go to work that day, and was reported missing. It is believed he left home on foot. He may still be in the Chelmsford area.

Tattoo: Right Forearm, angel wings with black and grey scripture

Case reference: 2012020129.CaseDesc: Nadine Lussier and Dominic Gauthier worked at a convenience store in Ste-Sophie. They were seen for the last time Wednesday, June 16th 2004. They left the convenience store around 3:00 p.m., and were then seen in a Prévost restaurant. Ms.Lussier's vehicle had not moved from the restaurant from the evening of Wednesday, June 16th 2004 and the time Dominic Gauthier's mother reported their disappearance on Friday June 18th 2004.

Case reference: 2014001077.CaseDesc: On February 27, 1974, the remains of a small, middle aged Indigenous man were found collapsed on Alexander Street in Vancouver, British Columbia. He had no natural teeth and had a star-like scar on his left wrist.

Case reference: 2018039302.CaseDesc: On February 17, 1992, at approximately 9:00 am, Glen Levy was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Prior to his disappearance, Glen had attempted to travel by bus to visit his father in Florida, USA.

Coat: Nylon, Black, Parka, green trim, 3/4 length

Case reference: 2006022299.CaseDesc: Nick Kostiuk was last seen in a boat leaving a dock on Lower Manitou Lake. He could not swim and his wife saw him leaving without a life jacket. Mr. Kostiuk has been presumed drowned.

Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Accutron watch
Glasses: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, wire frame

Case reference: 2014004990.CaseDesc: On January 6, 1978, at approximately 11:00 p.m., John McNichol was seen for the last time as he left the Crock & Block restaurant located in downtown Kitchener, Ontario. John had met with a friend that evening, and the two had planned to see each other again the next day. The following morning, he failed to show up for work and a note was found stating that he had to leave.

Luggage: SUITCASE, Suitcase, contained Leonard Cohen records
Shirt: Orange, « Grandma Lee » checkered, short sleeve

Case reference: 2012003399.CaseDesc: Gregory Porter, 26, was last seen on October 5, 1984, when he was honourably discharged from the army at the Canadian Forces Base in Wainwright, Alberta. He had told people that he was going to British Columbia to drive a taxi. He was in good health both physically and mentally. The initial investigation revealed that Mr. Porter cashed a bank draft for $2400 on October 9, 1984, at a Royal Bank in Edmonton, Alberta. His whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2009004699.CaseDesc: On September 14, 1994, Kenneth Blais, 27 years of age, had an argument with his mother. He left his residence on Levesque Street, Sturgeon Falls, Ontario, saying he was going to meet up with his father. The family assumed that Kenneth went to the Ottawa region. Kenneth never met up with his father and is still missing.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Cross done by hand

Case reference: 2016061373.CaseDesc: On March 30, 1980, an unidentified male was discovered floating in Lake Ontario at the rear of 2115 Lakeshore Blvd West. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 146lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present and he had moderate osteoarthritis of spine.

Case reference: 2014002284.CaseDesc: Richard Reitmeier has not been heard from or seen since the fall of 1988. There is not much known surrounding his disappearance.

Case reference: 2016068701.CaseDesc: On June 9, 1968, a male was recovered from the Detroit River just below Fighting Island, Amherstburg, Anderdon Township. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 180 lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. It is believed that he had been in the water for several months prior to recovery.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Several teeth were missing. The remaining teeth had amalgam or porcelain fillings.
Shirt: Brown, checkered sport shirt; button-front and long-sleeved

Case reference: 2021039166.CaseDesc: On January 9, 2003, the remains of an unidentified man were discovered in the Marshy area, west of 19842 Yonge Street in East Gwillimbury, Ontario.

Case reference: 2020006266.CaseDesc: On February 25, 1959, Richard "Ricky" Culford was seen for the last time on Ward’s Island in Toronto, Ontario. He was last seen playing on the beach with a stick. When his mother went to retrieve him, Ricky was gone.

Hat: Brown, Gabardine helmet with a peak

Case reference: 2014005006.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2007, Sun Jin, her husband Joon Han, and their daughter Il Han were seen for the last time at a school in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006020899.CaseDesc: Pooran Shivcharan, age 36, was last seen in an aircraft heading west bound in the direction of Geraldton, Ontario on November 13, 1981. Although he was originally headed toward Thunder Bay, he may have altered his course towards Geraldton or Raith.  Search efforts were unable to locate Mr. Shivcharan or his aircraft.

Case reference: 2017010385.CaseDesc: On September 26, 2015, at approximately 2:00 p.m., Fadi Zakir was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2013000079.CaseDesc: Gilles Chiasson has been missing from Montreal since April 18, 1995. Mr. Chiasson took a taxi after a night out in a bar and was never seen again.

Case reference: 2006000199.CaseDesc: October 26, 1986, an unidentified man was found under the ramp to the Gardiner Expressway and Spadina Avenue behind 252 Queens Quay West, in Toronto, Ontario. He was well-nourished, and was found not wearing any clothing.

Hair: Grey, White, Short, Male pattern baldness, 4mm facial stubble
Mark: Left Elbow, Small mole on the side of his left elbow

Case reference: 2014045101.CaseDesc: The partial remains of an older adult female were found near Chasm, British Colombia in 2010. She had no teeth in her lower jaw and had likely gone missing many years earlier.

Case reference: 2006011999.CaseDesc: On November 8, 1972, Henry King and Vancel Mcleod left King's Fishing Camp on Lake Huron to travel by boat to Thessalon where they were to deliver fish.  They never arrived at the intended destination.

Scar: Left Thumb, 1/2 to 3/4 inch in length.

Case reference: 2014003425.CaseDesc: Christopher Giberson, went missing from the Saint John Regional Hospital on Friday, January 28th, 2000, at 7:00 p.m. where he was taken for treatment and then assessment, but he walked away before being seen by staff.

Case reference: 2020009598.CaseDesc: Angela Reid was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Angela had been visiting from Jamaica and was due to return on September 12, 1983, but she never boarded her flight.

Case reference: 2020014650.CaseDesc: On December 2, 1919, at approximately 5:30pm, Ambrose Small was seen for the last time with his lawyer in his office at the Grand Opera House in Toronto, Ontario.

Coat: Other, Dark colour with velvet collar

Case reference: 2011000499.CaseDesc: In August 1996, Bruce Berthelot left his family residence in Leamington, Ontario. M. Berthelot indicated that he was going away for a little while and asked his mother for $1000. He had been unemployed for several months and was dealing with some health issues. Prior to leaving he telephoned his friends in Manitoba a number of times. His family believes that he was headed to Western Canada. He has lived in Manitoba in the past. Mr. Berthelot is a skilled carpenter, and enjoys fishing and boating.  He has had no contact with any members of his family or friends since leaving.

Case reference: 2006007299.CaseDesc: On November 1, 1985, Byron Simmons and Julie Ann Schneider were observed fishing from a boat in Lake Huron. They were near the Nuclear Power Generation Station, near Inverhuron, Ontario, in the outflow from the nuclear plant. The couple failed to return to their cottage and are presumed drowned.  Their boat was recovered the following spring washed up on shore to the north, near Oliphant, Ontario.

Hair: Grey, White, Other, Short, Afro style

Case reference: 2017072938.CaseDesc: On March 8, 1988, Nadine Sharp was seen for the last time. She was a student at the University of Toronto and went missing from her home in Etobicoke, Ontario.

Case reference: 2018026641.CaseDesc: On August 14, 1991, the body of an adult Asian male was found in the Burrard Inlet, British Columbia. He was slim and healthy, with no tattoos and his teeth were in good condition. It is believed he was deceased for only one or two days prior to his body being recovered.

Case reference: 2014003746.CaseDesc: On August 2, 1972, Mario Cardinal was reported missing by his family. At the time of his disappearance, he lived in Trois-Rivières, Quebec.

Case reference: 2009005099.CaseDesc: Russell Hoffert was a voluntary patient of the North Bay Psychiatric Hospital, Highway 11 North, in North Bay, Ontario. Mr. Hoffert walked away from the hospital grounds, in poor winter like weather and was not properly dressed for the conditions. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2018039090.CaseDesc: On December 6, 1996, at approximately 10:00 a.m., San Lee was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, San was terminally ill and despondent.

Case reference: 2009002799.CaseDesc: Terry Zubko was a resident of Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario and had been a patient of the North Bay Psychiatric Hospital. Terry left the hospital on July 21, 1982, at 10:00 AM. It is unknown what his diagnosis was at the time, however, reports indicate he suffers from amnesia that requires medication. He was last seen at the North Bay Psychiatric Hospital (which became the Northeast Mental Health Centre, before being torn down in 2013)

Shirt: May have been wearing a white pullover type shirt
Pants: May have been wearing brown corduroy pants or blue jeans

Case reference: 2014005263.CaseDesc: On November 1, 2007, Annie Proulx was seen for the last time in the Rimouski area in Quebec. Annie has not been seen or heard from since.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , Rose, Heart and Bulldog

Case reference: 2014005133.CaseDesc: On August 11, 2008, Laventus Burke was reported missing. He left a note to his mother stating he was going to Alberta to work and then move to Florida. Mr. Burke is known to have worked in Grand Prairie previously and may have returned there. He has been diagnosed with schizophrenia.

Case reference: 2016068706.CaseDesc: On June 19, 1967, an unidentified male, believed to be between the ages of 35 to 50 years old, was found in the water chute at the rear of 115 Cameron Avenue in Dundas. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 180 lbs and his length was measured at 6'0", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He was found naked. His appendix was present. He is believed to have been dead for 3 to 4 weeks.

Teeth: Visible Missing, A single amalgam filling is noted, as well as, an unerrupted 2nd molar. Many teeth of the lower jaw missing.

Case reference: 2012020088.CaseDesc: Norbert Couillonneur was last seen on Thursday, May 27, 2010, at Pinehouse Lake, SK, wearing blue jeans and a light blue t-shirt. He is known to travel back and forth from Pinehouse Lake to Canoe Lake, SK.

Case reference: 2014005984.CaseDesc: In 1972, Patricia Salamandyk was seen for the last time as she got off of the school bus with her sister in Spruce Grove, Parkland County, in Alberta. Patricia had told her sister that she was not going to school that day, and she has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014002167.CaseDesc: On July 7th, 1973, Mr. Gorrie and his family were seen returning from a day of fishing on Cross Lake by the local RCMP patrol. Mr. Gorrie followed the patrol boat for some time and eventually the family boarded the patrol boat while Mr. Gorrie continued to follow in his boat. Both vessels proceeded west however after a time, the height of the waves increased (7 to 8 ft.). As a result the patrol boat had to increase power, which substantially increased the distance between the respective boats. Mr. Gorrie's boat was last seen a 1/2 mile behind the patrol. Immediate searches by air provided negative results. It is presumed that Mr. Gorrie drowned as he or the boat have never been located.

Case reference: 2009001399.CaseDesc: Calvin Vanness was last seen on March 26, 2008 at approximately 2:30 PM in the Quinte Mall parking lot in Belleville, Ontario. He last spoke to his family to make plans to meet later that day. When he failed to meet them, his family attempted to locate him, then reported him missing on March 31, 2008. His car was located on April 1, 2008 at the Highway 38 car park in Kingston, Ontario. He was known to carry large sums of money and some cannabis. Mr. Vanness has not accessed any of his bank accounts since his disappearance.

Case reference: 2020009419.CaseDesc: On August 6, 1989, at approximately 12:00pm, Jessica Sakouhi was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Jessica was visiting from France and was due to return back on August 19, but she did not board the plane.

Case reference: 2015050965.CaseDesc: On October 29th, 1973 Kenneth Roy was reported missing from the Nepisiguit River area approximately 75-80 miles from Bathurst, New Brunswick. Kenneth had left to go on a hunting trip alone and was known to be an experienced woodsman.

Hat: Red, Beige, Cap, Reversible to blue
Chain: Compass hanging on a shoelace and worn as a necklace
Watch: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Timex, With expansion bracelet

Case reference: 2014005230.CaseDesc: On March 9, 2009, Daniel Moisan was last seen leaving a residence in Victoriaville to go to an acquaintance’s house. Daniel has not been seen since.

Coat: Nylon, Black, Orange, Brand: Harley Davidson

Case reference: 2012020093.CaseDesc: On April 20, 2003, Garry Guenther, 58 years old, left his residence in the Hepburn district, SK. He was driving his white 1993 Ford F-150 truck with SK licence GGG. Mr. Guenther was reported to have been seen in Hoey, SK on the 23rd/ 24th of April, 2003, however, neither he nor his vehicle have been located.

Sweater: Cotton, Grey, sweat shirt with an image of a fish on the front
Deformity: Right Leg, bow-legged, walks with noticeable limp

Case reference: 2014003922.CaseDesc: On Saturday July 15, 1972, Mr. Zukewhich and a friend took a canoe on to Clearwater Lake. Witnesses state that both men were under the influence of alcohol and that they took alcohol with them into the canoe. Witnesses further noted that the lake was extremely rough due to high winds. Mr. Zukewhich and friend were seen departing around 1600 hrs heading towards an area known as Long Point. A resident of Long Point advised police he observed one person in the red canoe which was sitting flat indicating weight in the front. The canoe was recovered on July 17th. Despite extensive searching, Mr. Zukewhich was never located.

Case reference: 2016050007.CaseDesc: On August 11, 2016, the day of his birthday, Martin Ste-Croix was seen for the last time as he left his family residence. He told his family that he wanted to go to western Canada, specifically to Kelowna, British Columbia, to look for work. Martin left without his passport, little money and clothing.

Case reference: 2014000001.CaseDesc: Emma Fillipoff was last seen in the Victoria Inner Harbour area on November 28, 2012.  She was reported to be a shy and quiet person and had been staying at a local shelter for about 6 months prior to her going missing. It is believed that Emma may have been suffering from the onset of some mental health issues. She was barefoot, but carrying a pair of blue or grey running shoes.  Emma did not use or abuse drugs or alcohol.

Luggage: Canvas, Other, Light coloured canvas bag
Shoes: Blue, Grey, Was barefoot, but carrying a pair of blue or grey running shoes

Case reference: 2014004298.CaseDesc: On June 25, 2002, Spencer Shinjo Aoki left his apartment in Vancouver, British Columbia and never returned. Spencer did not take any personal items with him and left behind things that were of high value to him.

Case reference: 2017023444.CaseDesc: In July 1948, June Pauline Stevens was living in Cadillac, Saskatchewan when she disappeared and has not been heard from since. Ms. Stevens was thought to have travelled west to Port Alberni, BC to join her mother or to Winnipeg, MB to join other relatives.

Case reference: 2021003909.CaseDesc: On April 6, 2018, Rita Squalli and Maria Squalli were last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Rita and Maria were taken by their father under false pretences, and it is believed that the girls are being kept overseas.

Case reference: 2006009099.CaseDesc: John Samuel Clifford was last seen on October 10, 1987. He was fishing and hunting near Floods Landing, on Frederickshouse River, in the Township of Blount, District of Cochrane. An extensive search of the area has failed to locate him.

Boots: Rubber, Green, Red, construction safety boots
Coat: Wool, Green, Parka, hydro work jacket

Case reference: 2014004602.CaseDesc: Denis Gelinas left his home in Notre-Dame-Du-Mont-Carmel on the morning of December 31, 1993 and was never seen again.

Tattoo: Right Arm, Snake and a dagger

Case reference: 2005001599.CaseDesc: Shawn Jones and Leslie Jones were seen on October 24, 1993. The two boys were hitchhiking from Cape Croker to Wiarton. They were dropped off in downtown Wiarton. Between October 26-28, 1993 Leslie Jones was seen with another male fitting the description of Shawn Jones. They were seen together at the Tim Hortons coffee shop in Owen Sound, Ontario. Shawn Jones was last seen on Berford Street in front of Pacific Hotel. Leslie Jones was last seen in front of the Tim Horton's restaurant on 9th East Street.

Case reference: 2014003839.CaseDesc: On October 20, 1988, George Leslie was seen for the last time at his residence in the city of St. Catharines, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, George was despondent. His vehicle was subsequently located abandoned in a parking lot in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2005003899.CaseDesc: On September 5, 2001, a Caucasian male was found on a bench in an outhouse on a cross country ski trail in the Laurentian Hills, Deep River. He was well-tanned and had recently got a sunburn on his face. He was circumcised and his appendix was present. He is estimated to have been dead for two to three days. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts this unidentified male is of European ancestry.

Glasses: Copper, Koh Sakai, frame model KS9365, reflective lens
Jewelry: Blue, Levi's, Blue faced, built in compass watch
Shoes: Black, Replay, size small running shoes
Jeans: Blue, Pepe, size 30, button fly front

Case reference: 2011002199.CaseDesc: Sean Tan went missing from his residence, an apartment building on Huron Street in Toronto, on March 7, 2011. Toronto Police Service investigated but to date he has not been located. Mr. Tan  may be despondent and suicidal.

Case reference: 2018007092.CaseDesc: On February 8, 2018, at approximately 4:15pm, Wenting Liu was seen for the last time at Yorkdale Mall in Toronto, Ontario. Wenting was visiting Canada and failed to board her returning flight on February 10.

Coat: Pink, Puffy with fur hood and knee length

Case reference: 2022012467.CaseDesc: On September 14, 1988, Paul Moore was seen for the last time as he left his residence in Lewiston, New York. His vehicle was subsequently found abandoned in a parking lot near the American Falls. During the time of his disappearance, Paul was despondent.

Case reference: 2020036483.CaseDesc: Dorothy Cox was seen for the last time between the months of December 1942 and April 1943 in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005776.CaseDesc: James Turgeon was last seen on Wednesday, April 17, 2012 at approximately 3:00 p.m. traveling East on foot on Highway #16 near North Battleford, SK. Mr. Turgeon has known mental health issues and has been diagnosed with schizophrenia. He has a history of walking away from his residence, but will usually return. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2015011647.CaseDesc: On June 13, 1994, the body of a woman was found floating in the St. Lawrence River at St-Jean Baptiste Street in the Pointe aux Trembles area of Montreal. She took good care of her teeth and according to experts the body would have been in the water for about 4 months.

Shoes: Leather, Brown, Black, black pattern on the side and orthopedic supports in acrylic brown and red in both shoes
Scar: Chest, right and left breast surgery
Chest, has possibly undergone a partial ablation

Case reference: 2014002295.CaseDesc: On July 25, 1979, James Caraley was last seen when he went mountain climbing on Mount Andromeda in Jasper, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014005536.CaseDesc: In the afternoon of March 25, 1996, Renée Simard was seen for the last time as she left her family home in Matane, Quebec. Renée had indicated that she was going for a walk, and at approximately 2:30 p.m. she was seen near the wharf along the Matane River at the mouth of the St. Lawrence River.

Case reference: 2014005223.CaseDesc: On March 4th, 2009, Wesley Foulds , 52, left his Abbotsford residence for an appointment in New Westminster.  Mr. Foulds didn't arrive for his appointment, and didn't show up for work later that day.  Mr. Foulds' vehicle was discovered the next day parked near the Hayward Dam in Mission BC.

Case reference: 2014003355.CaseDesc: Kelsey Brew and his friends were playing on the rocks on the shores of the Hudson Bay in Churchill. According to the witness Kelsey attempted to help another boy who had fallen in the water. As Kelsey was helping, a wave came in and he also slipped into the water. A large number of volunteers walked the shoreline and boat patrols failed to locate him. It is assumed Kelsey drowned.

Scar: Cheek, 3 on left side of face

Case reference: 2015011652.CaseDesc: On December 8, 1998, a ship from Lisbon arrived at the port of Montreal. The captain of the ship discovered the body of a man in the back part of the liner. The captain thinks it's a stowaway.

Case reference: 2006021899.CaseDesc: De Qian Rang was last seen on April 20, 1992 in the Village of Elora, Ontario. At the time of her disappearance De Qian and her husband operated the 'Abacus Restaurant', south of Elora. An extensive police investigation has failed to locate Mrs. Rang.  Police suspect foul play in her disappearance.

Case reference: 2006019499.CaseDesc: David Block was reported missing from Swastika, Ontario. He had been seen in Newfoundland in 1994.  Mr. Block suffered from mental health issues that could bring him to the attention of authorities. He was last seen in Washington D.C., U.S.A, on May 1, 1995.

Case reference: 2012020038.CaseDesc: Desiree Oldwoman was last seen near her home on the Siksika Fist Nations Reserve near Gleichen, Alberta. She is autistic and does not speak, although she can write her name. Ms. Oldwoman was last seen on August 27, 2011.

Case reference: 2018063443.CaseDesc: On July 2, 2003, at approximately 7:00 a.m., Sergio Rodriguez was seen for the last time by his wife in Toronto, Ontario. When Sergio’s wife had returned home from work, he and all of his belongings were gone.

Case reference: 1999000140.CaseDesc: On April 3, 1993, Mary Nancy Goodfellow left home in the company of her grandson Kevin James Charles. Nothing has been heard from them since.

Scar: Forehead, scar on right side of forehead

Case reference: 2014002868.CaseDesc: On August 2, 1989, Ronald Jack last spoke with his mother. During that telephone discussion, Ronald had informed her that he and his wife, Doreen Jack, would be leaving for a “camp job”. He had also said that they would be gone for approximately 10 days, and would be back before their sons, Russell and Ryan Jack, started their school year in September.

Case reference: 2020011626.CaseDesc: On September 18, 1989, Ioan Sandea was seen for the last time leaving his residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2013000017.CaseDesc: In August 1983, Jannisina "Jan" Stonehouse left her home in Oakville and has not been seen since. She may have left home due to being pregnant.  Jannisina may have been in the company of Darlene Tucker who is also missing. Refer to case 1993001330

Teeth: Good, Four teeth treated (one tooth had partial nerve treatment), one tooth absent lower left jaw. Dental chart on file.

Case reference: 2014047580.CaseDesc: On November 22, 1979, an unidentified Caucasian male, approximately 50 years old, suffered a major medical trauma while in the Safeway store on 97St and 107Av in Edmonton, Alberta. He was rushed to the Royal Alexandra Hospital Intensive Care Unit. The man died in the hospital the following day. The Medical Examiner's office took photos of the man and forwarded them to the Edmonton Police Department (now Service). The Medical Examiner's Office deemed the death to be the result of natural causes.

Case reference: 2000000830.CaseDesc: Charlene was last seen hitch-hiking at the intersection of Hwy 3 and the Rae Access Road.

Case reference: 2021022385.CaseDesc: On May 28, 2021, Kienan Tran was reported missing from his residence in West St. Paul, Manitoba. In May, a representative from property management entered Kienan’s residence and noticed that it was vacant. Additional details revealed that Kienan was engaged in a high-risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2020008549.CaseDesc: On March 26, 1976, at approximately 12:30pm, Licelia D’Costa was last seen by her landlady in Toronto, Ontario. Licelia had told her roommate that she was headed to Ottawa, Ontario.

Case reference: 2008016999.CaseDesc: Meryl Newcombe and George Weeden were last seen and reported missing to the White River OPP on October 29, 1959. The two men had been at a lodge operated by Mr. Newcombe at Mile 107 of the CPR line, west of Chapleau, Ontario. Mr. Weeden and Mr. Newcombe had planned a hunting trip and both were last seen between mile marker 106 and 107 of the CPR line southeast of White River and west of Chapleau. A large-scale search was conducted at the time, and again in the following spring (1960).  The search failed to locate the two men, and to date, they have not been located. Mr. Weeden exact date of birth is not known, but his year of birth is understood to be 1896 or 1897.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Leg, injured in a train wreck in 1941

Case reference: 2012020126.CaseDesc: Rollande Doherty, 52 years old, disappeared on February 2nd 2007. She was last seen around 2:30pm near the library in Rouyn-Noranda.

Case reference: 2006020199.CaseDesc: Christopher Nemmers was last seen on August 11, 1992 on the Sturgeon River. He was going to drain water from a boat and was heard calling for help, then seen slipping under the water. He is presumed drowned and his body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2013000044.CaseDesc: Carole Roy, who also went by several aliases, was last seen in 1996 near Carlton Place, Ontario. Ms. Roy has lived in Carlton Place, Ottawa, and various places in Quebec. She was reported missing by her family.

Case reference: 2006029199.CaseDesc: On October 27, 2006, a female was found in a field near the South Service Road and Holt Road near the Darlington Nuclear Plant in Bowmanville, Ontario. She may have been anemic, but a doctor may or may not have diagnosed this condition. Near the body there was a ring, size 9.5, that has a red garnet in the middle with a diamond on either side. The ring is stamped "Burns" on the inside and is believed to have been sold through Burns Jeweler in Oshawa, Ontario. A heart, a ribbon and a multi coloured "Blue Rodeo" brand t-shirt with a hood were also found in the vicinity of the remains and may or may not belong to her.

Teeth: Prominent upper teeth with visible white fillings on her front teeth; and small silver fillings in some back teeth.
Shirt: Other, T-Shirt, Blue Rodeo with thick vertical stripes in red, green and blue.
Ring: Metal, Size 9.5, Burns logo, with a red garnet and two diamonds

Case reference: 2014004957.CaseDesc: On New Year's Eve, 2002 an anonymous letter was received by the Vancouver Police Department. The letter referred to a female Vancouver sex trade worker who had disappeared one month earlier, at the end of November. The letter writer described the woman, admitted to killing her, and apologized to her family for taking her life. Investigators believe the letter writer was referring to Danielle Marissa Larue, and while her body has never been found, they believe that she was murdered. The letter writer knows what happened to Danielle, and police are hopeful that the writer will contact them again.

Case reference: 2006007099.CaseDesc: On July 21, 1995, Erwyn Lippett and his friend, Kirk Weidmann, left the Brucedale conservation area to go for a canoe ride on Lake Huron, near Port Elgin, Ontario. Two life-jackets and two paddles were recovered in the water. Neither man has been seen since.

Mark: Forehead, Large mole on forehead at receding hairline

Tattoo: Right Arm, Boot Hill with cross
Chest, clouds with name Simon and Victoria

Case reference: 2014004667.CaseDesc: The Gypsumville RCMP detachment received a report that an aircraft was in distress over Lake Winnipeg near Reindeer Island. The aircraft, a single engine Cherokee 140, had three people on board; the pilot and two passengers. The pilot had indicated that the engine had seized and that he was trying to make it to Reindeer Island. He then stated that he was going down in to the water. Two RCMP Twin Otters and an Air Search and Rescue Hercules conducted a search by air. It was not possible to search the lake by boat as there was too much ice on the lake. All three are presumed dead due to drowning or from the impact of the crash.

Case reference: 2015018154.CaseDesc: On July 17, 1966, Delores Whiteman was last seen in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014001849.CaseDesc: On August 14, 1974, Murphy Williams was last seen working in a labour camp located between Fort St. John and Dawson Creek in British Columbia. It was reported that Mr. Williams was exhibiting signs of distress and it is believed that he may have attempted to walk from the labour camp to Fort St. John.

Case reference: 2021025959.CaseDesc: On March 1, 1988, a man fell from the Jacques-Cartier Bridge in Longueuil, Quebec. The man died a few hours later and was never identified. The images shown are facial approximation portraits of this unidentified man created by the Sûreté du Québec.

Hair: Brown, Auburn, Long, Wavy, Dark, fine, long and wavy
Socks: White, Red, White with red and navy blue stripes
Sweater: Cotton, Black, Short sleeved, "3310" brand, size small
Pants: Cotton, Blue, Elastics at waist, "Alpine" brand, size 30-76
Coat: Black, Short with cotton cuffs, "Paradise Express" brand
Scar: Chin, Scar on right side of chin, 1.5 cm
